channel.title: Internet problemzzz
channel.description: Its my stupid modem. It turns on, says it is receiving and sending packets but when it gets to online, it just blinks and I ternet doesn't work. Anyone know how to fix?

item.title: Internet problemzzz
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

RiiPiiNFtW:

My modem is sending and receiving packets fine. Its just blinking on the online light

blinking of the online light means it is working… If the link light is solid or not on then you have a problem…

Read full topic

I had a similar problem before, called my ISP, they sent a new modem. Problem solved, turns out the modem got fried somehow.

Fair enough, sorry I read over my posts and it seemed more hostile to you rather than helpful to the OP.

item.title: Internet problemzzz
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“Kidpaparoach, post:6, topic:430147”]@jmood… -Sigh- I meant, don’t listen to anyone wanting to help on the technical side as they will just end up making random guesses at what it could be however his ISP will usually know where to tackle the problem.

I scanned the OP’s thread then posted but also reading over it again ‘as it turns on’ therefore meaning he has switched it off and on before so therefore what your saying has already been done and + when I was 11 I even knew what your suggesting and I’ve seen the OP comment on other things before and he seems to have a knowledge base higher of a eleven year old in that department for sure.
Anyways, if it is a Hardware problem if the Hardware which was provided is not working correctly you can get a free replacement usually.[/quote]

My suggestion was more pointed towards a router… The reason I said turn the modem off is because that is what most ISP make you do… They have you turn off all connected devices to both the modem and router, then turn the router off, then turn the modem off, you then have to wait for some modems, since they use a battery to stay on when a fast power outage happens. Then they have you reconnect the devices, modem on, router on, devices connecting them on. Which should make everything work. I know that a lot of Comcast modems have an updating problem when you lose power fast, but the modem doesn’t fully shut down…

Read full topic

item.title: Internet problemzzz
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

@jmood… -Sigh- I meant, don’t listen to anyone wanting to help on the technical side as they will just end up making random guesses at what it could be however his ISP will usually know where to tackle the problem.

I scanned the OP’s thread then posted but also reading over it again ‘as it turns on’ therefore meaning he has switched it off and on before so therefore what your saying has already been done and + when I was 11 I even knew what your suggesting and I’ve seen the OP comment on other things before and he seems to have a knowledge base higher of a eleven year old in that department for sure.
Anyways, if it is a Hardware problem if the Hardware which was provided is not working correctly you can get a free replacement usually.

Read full topic

item.title: Internet problemzzz
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“Kidpaparoach, post:4, topic:430147”]Rather than listening to anyone on this site just call up your provider they have to fix it or refund you as you have a subscription for Internet provided with them, if there is an issue with what they are providing the law states(I believe it will state it where you live too) that they must provide you with what the contract you will have signed states. Since it isn’t an issue from your side, if it is an issue from your side which it doesn’t sound like it is do a check by connecting with a different device and seeing if it can access the internet if not its there problem.
Oh and also a good thing to do is complain about how it affected your work or something and say it caused your discomfort and if it has a decent customer service department they will give you a discount or something, if you make it sound like it affected something that caused inconvieniance your more likely to get a discount or something but try not to say things that costed you money as they might ask for a receipt. This isn’t just personal knowledge btw, did customer services in college as part of my course Business so this is one of the areas I know about;p.[/quote]

As this poster said don’t listen to them… “Rather than listening to anyone on this site”

Reading over the OPs post again, you can clearly tell it is a problem on his side. When a modem is set up correctly it will blink, this means it’s sending and receiving packets correctly. If the light was a solid or didn’t even turn on then you would have a problem, either being hardware or service side.

As I already said try restarting both your modem and router if you have one, and also check to make sure your networking device is set up correctly.

Read full topic

Rather than listening to anyone on this site just call up your provider they have to fix it or refund you as you have a subscription for Internet provided with them, if there is an issue with what they are providing the law states(I believe it will state it where you live too) that they must provide you with what the contract you will have signed states. Since it isn’t an issue from your side, if it is an issue from your side which it doesn’t sound like it is do a check by connecting with a different device and seeing if it can access the internet if not its there problem.
Oh and also a good thing to do is complain about how it affected your work or something and say it caused your discomfort and if it has a decent customer service department they will give you a discount or something, if you make it sound like it affected something that caused inconvieniance your more likely to get a discount or something but try not to say things that costed you money as they might ask for a receipt. This isn’t just personal knowledge btw, did customer services in college as part of my course Business so this is one of the areas I know about;p.

item.title: Internet problemzzz
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

It could be a problem on the ISP side, but it could also be a problem on your side, do you have a router connected to your modem?

If you do, I suggest you shut both the router and modem off, then restart the modem, and then start the router. The Modem will connect and should start working properly. I know when ever we lose power our modem stops working and this seems to fix it.

Read full topic
